item.title: Authorities were warned five years ago of issue that wrought havoc on Sydney trains and did nothing
item.description: <p>A scathing review has savaged NSW transport authorities over the lead-up and response to the failure that brought the Sydney train network to a standstill in June.</p>

item.title: Why days are getting a little brighter across Australia
item.description: <p>Days are now becoming longer than nights across Australia.</p>

item.title: Murder charge after man 'deliberately struck' with car on Kalgoorlie road
item.description: <p>A 29-year-old man has been charged with murder after a 42-year-old man was allegedly struck by a car in Western Australia yesterday.</p>

item.title: Coroner probes death of newborn baby at Queensland hospital
item.description: <p>An inquest into Hugo McGregor&#x27;s hospital death is underway in the Queensland coroners court at Townsville, detailing the string of problems encountered before the family&#x27;s gut-wrenching call.</p>

item.title: NRL news 2025: M﻿ark Nawaqanitawase set to leave Sydney Roosters, return to rugby union; Phil Gould comments
item.description: M﻿ark Nawaqanitawase's stint in the NRL with the Sydney Roosters looks set to end next year, with the cross-code sensation expected to switch back to rugby union in a bid to play for the Wallabies in the 2027 World Cup.

item.title: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley accused of running 'rogue foreign policy' over Palestine letter
item.description: <p>The Opposition Leader wrote to a group of United States Republicans to assure Congress members that a Coalition government would revoke Palestinian recognition if elected.</p>

item.title: RBA promises to keep cash as payment option 'for as long as Australians want or need to use it'
item.description: <p>Reserve Bank Governor Michele Bullock has promised to keep cash as a viable payment option despite only 5.5 per cent of the population relying on notes, but a declining number of bank branches has left some worried.</p>

item.title: Woman arrested after allegedly trying to rob bank with stolen knife
item.description: <p>A﻿ woman has been arrested in Sydney&#x27;s south following an alleged attempted bank robbery.</p>

item.title: Tears in court as video shows bus fatally pinning teen against wall
item.description: <p>The family of a teenager fatally struck by a council bus in a city centre have sobbed as graphic video of the collision has been played in court.</p>

item.title: 'Miracle' as police dog Rocco escapes horror crash on Melbourne freeway with only a few scrapes
item.description: <p>A﻿ white Mercedes Benz allegedly crashed into the back of a police car in Tullamarine overnight.</p>

item.title: Four men charged with theft of 40 guns, but majority still haven't been found
item.description: <p>In the period of one week in March, the firearms were allegedly taken from a house on Seascape Close in Narrawallee, about 224 kilometres south of Sydney.</p>

item.title: Corporate watchdog takes major insurance company to court for allegedly misleading customers
item.description: <p>A﻿SIC claims that a major Australian insurance company issued hundreds of thousands of misleading insurance policy renewals.</p>

item.title: Former SA Police contractor accused of possessing child abuse material
item.description: <p>A former SA Police contractor has been arrested after he allegedly livestreamed sexually explicit material of children in the Philippines.</p>

item.title: Melbourne father and son accused of murdering man over stolen wallet
item.description: <p>Abdurhman Jemal, 33, was shot dead outside a Glenroy shopping strip in Melbourne&#x27;s north about 4.30am on March 29, 2024.</p>

item.title: NRL news 2025: Victor Radley breaks silence over Sydney Roosters sanction
item.description: Victor Radley has broken his silence on his massive 10-game suspension and $30,000 fine from the Sydney Roosters due to his involvement in the Brandon Smith saga, as well as where his relationship with chairman Nick Politis stands.

item.title: AFL news 2025: Hawthorn star Mabior Chol cleared of three-game ban by tribunal, Tom Stewart concussion
item.description: Hawthorn's M﻿abior Chol will be free to play in game one of the 2026 season after his appeal to overturn a three-game ban at the AFL tribunal was deemed successful.

item.title: 'Night Stalker' admits 18 rapes against eight women in the 1990s
item.description: <p>At least 10 women reported being assaulted in Sydney&#x27;s Moore Park and inner-west areas between 1991 and 1993.</p>

item.title: Sydneysiders to pay $475 more on water bills by 2030
item.description: <p>The average Sydney household&#x27;s yearly water bill will increase after a review to increase benchmark water costs.</p>

item.title: Gold Coast's iconic Marina Mirage set for demolition to make way for new development

item.title: Adelaide facing major traffic delays if bid to host COP31 succeeds

item.description: <p>Posing as good Samaritans, two beer bandits reportedly helped the driver re-load some of his cargo before pinching a couple.</p>

item.title: Super typhoon blowing by northern Philippines and Taiwan forces evacuations and closures
item.description: <p>Thousands of people were evacuated from northern Philippine villages and schools and offices were closed on Monday in the archipelago and neighbouring Taiwan as one of this year&#x27;s strongest typhoons threatened to cause flooding and landslides on its way to southeastern China.</p>
